data.title: Very Good Hawaiian Style Food in Utah
data.text: Moki's was one of the first Hawaiian grills in the valley and, along with with Mo Bettah Steaks, our favorite place for kalua.  The other meal that we always order here is the fish and chips.  Excellent fish and a large portion for $7.95.  Most entrees come with macaroni salad or sticky rice and salad.  This place is always very busy during the lunch hour (a testament to their food), so come early if you want a table without a wait.  The people who run this place are always friendly and helpful with menu questions.

data.title: Big Island Flavor at an affordable price!
data.text: Good selection of Hawaiian favorites including Kahlua pork and various chicken dishes. Wonderful compliment of salads, beverages and unusual condiments. Plus there's live entertainment and a buffet once a month - very popular!

data.title: Decent but nothing stand out about it.
data.text: Nice atmosphere and the place is clean. I felt it was a little pricey for what I got. I don't know that I would go back again.

data.title: Taste of Hawaii in Utah!
data.text: I haven't looked hard to find Hawaiian in Utah, however, my boyfriend found this place and we are fans! We recently spent a two week vacay in Oahu and the Big Island. This place does remind us of the standard "Hawaiian plate lunch" you can find in Hawaii. We both ordered the two meat combo! The teriyaki chicken and teriyaki beef are great. The kalua pork was good too. We haven't tried the fish, but they do have a few seafood options. They advertise a Luau on the 3rd Friday of every month. We haven't been, but I would go out on s limb to suggest it! Give this place a try!

data.title: Reasonable Prices, Great Food
data.text: Moki's is a little family owned restaurant. The place is very clean, the staff is friendly and accommodating.  The food is fresh and delicious.  There is a nice variety of items to choose from, and several sampler type meals.  They have a buffet on Friday nights. We don't live as close to it as we used to, but the food is worth the travel.  We try to go at least every other month.  Off the beaten path, and worth every penny.

data.title: Very good hawaiin food and always very clean!!
data.text: Pulled pork and rice plate always good. Place is always spotless and welcoming owners. I try to make a stop by once a month when on this side of the valley!

data.title: Polynesian family Island Grub
data.text: I live right by and had wanted to go in for some time. A Groupon was just the push I needed. My wife and I found it neat and clean but with little frills. The staff/family was very hospitable and the food came fresh and hot. My wife had the grilled shrimp and I had the teriyaki chicken and coconut shrimp. The chicken was good but the coconut shrimp was fantastic and my wife loved the grilled shrimp. The Hawaiian salad side was a slaw that was nothing special but getting the meal for half off made anything not perfect just fine. Pineapple finished off the meal and got a pineapple/mango smoothie for dessert. I believe the prices reflect what I would pay full price. We will be back for the luau that takes place every 3rd week, I forget the exact day but its buffet style for $12. We left feeling like family.

data.title: A great place for some delicious food
data.text: On a recent trip to Salt Lake City found a deal coupon for this restaurant and boy am I glad that we did because otherwise I would have probably not found this place. The food was just great great and their Moki table sauce was so good I asked them to sell me some that I brought back home with me, it is simply the bomb! The staff was very nice, the ambiance was cool and the food was simply define!

data.title: Aloha love!
data.text: Absolutely delicious!  We're visiting from out of town and came across Moki's by chance.  I'm so glad we did!  Not only was the food FANTASTIC but the staff were amazingly friendly, attentive,  and helpful.  Mahalo for the awesome lunch, Moki's!

data.title: Great authentic Hawaiian food
data.text: Cute little Hawaiian place. Definitely hole in a wall kind of feel. We got excited when we saw 2 Hawaiian people working in the kitchen. Very cheap $8-9 a plate, huge portions. Kalua pork and Mac salad are as good as on the islands. Very friendly people, I think the management changed since some of those reviews came out.  Must go if you like Hawaiian food!

data.title: Don't go anywhere else in UT for HI grinds!!!!!!
data.text: My wife and I just got back from Hawaii and visited multiple islands and we seriously ate mostly plate lunches everyday! (Lunch and Dinner) I have tried all the spots in the salt lake valley for Hawaiian food and this place is 'mo betta' than them ALL!! (if you know what I mean?!) Seriously you don't want to waist your money going anywhere else!! My wife and I get the #1 mixed plate every time and love it! Their Chicken Katso is phenomenal!!! Love the Kalua pork and the tery chicken and beef are awesome!! Don't skip out on the Mac salad either!!! This place feels like home and feels like Hawaii all the way!!!

data.title: Hard to find Hawaiian
data.text:
What a tasty surprise! My girlfriend and I stopped in for lunch. We both left stuffed!  

The portions were large and really good. I had the mahi mahi and was really pleased. My girlfriend loved her pork dish. 

The Hawaiian salad with the fish was ideal. We will definitely stop in again when in the area.

data.title: Great Place to Escape for Lunch
data.text: My first experience was a positive one. Upon entering I was greeted with a friendly "Aloha" and suggestions from the menu. I ordered the Ohana plate which includes grilled Mahi Mahi, Coconut Shrimp and Teriyaki Chicken, your choice of brown or white steamed rice, and choice of salad. I had the Hawaiian Salad, which was a simple cole slaw with chicken and Chinese noodles. I think I will try the macaroni salad next time. My favorite off the plate was the Mahi Mahi. I would have given them a 5 if the shrimp had more of a coconut flavor. I will definitely go back, but next time I will order dessert first and will sample the Kalua pork. I took leftovers back to the office. And, upon leaving, I heard a mighty "Mahalo" from several employees.

data.title: The first luau I had to wear a coat to!
data.text: We took our small kids and went to Moki's on  the 3rd friday night of the month. We had been told that is the one time a month that they offer a luau/buffet to try a little bit of everything on their menu. It was a great idea! The kids loved to food, which is saying something and so did the adults. It is a small establishment and buffet night was popular so seating was very limited. The service was friendly and the buffet was constantly topped off with fresh pickins. It's a great alternative for something different a long, long way from the islands.

data.title: AWFUL
data.text:
AWFUL.

They are under new management and the food is now terrible.
This was one of our favorite places to eat but no more.

Don't go even if you are tempted by their half off specials.  The food is onlt half edible.

data.title: Authentic food, pleasant staff, average prices.
data.text: My wife an I love it. We could go elsewhere but the food is good and the staff although teenagers are pleasant and speak to their parents and others in a Hawaiian language I think. It's fun and they some times have live music. My meal was tropical ribs, side cut, with white flavored rice. A small cold salad and a slice of pineapple. It was $7.50 and I would order it again easily. Definately recommend.

data.title: A little taste of the islands just up the street!  Kalua Pig Platter is da kine.
data.text: A little taste of the islands just up the street!  Kalua Pig Platter is da kine.

data.title: It's alright. I've been...
data.text: It's alright. I've been to better Hawaiian Grill. However, the service is wonderful in this small restaurant. Nice place to be.
